descriptions: Hello, I am a Lecturer in the Institute of Information and Communication Technology at Shahjalal University of Science and Technology (SUST), Sylhet, since November 2023. I teach a range of foundational and advanced courses including Software Verification and Validation, Software Architecture and Design Pattern, Data Structures, Algorithm Design and Analysis, Competitive Programming, and Introduction to Software Engineering. I also mentor undergraduate students in their thesis and research projects.

Before joining SUST, I worked as a Software Engineer at Dynamic Solution Innovators (DSi) for over two and a half years. During that time, I was involved in impactful projects such as OpenCRVS (a civil registration platform) and InfoReach (a banking solution). I continue to collaborate with DSi as a consultant alongside my academic responsibilities.

My current research focuses on the intersection of Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence, particularly enhancing software reliability, program analysis, optimizing software maintenance, automating software engineering processes, such as finding and fixing bugs, generating test cases, and building smarter developer tools. I am currently leading two research projects in this area in collaboration with undergraduate students. I aim to pursue a Ph.D. in Software Engineering, with a focus on intelligent systems and AI-assisted software development tools, to contribute further to the field through research and innovation.

researches.title: Comparisons of Large Language Models for JavaScript Test Case Generation
researches.description: This study investigates the effectiveness of large language models (LLMs) in generating unit and end-to-end test cases for JavaScript code using Jest and Selenium. The research compares LLM performance under varying prompt contexts (code-only, contextual, and combined) and evaluates the generated tests using mutation testing, code coverage, and standard quality metrics. The project involves guiding two undergraduate students through idea development, dataset creation, prompt design, automation of evaluation pipelines, and manuscript preparation for peer-reviewed submission.

researches.title: Evaluating LLM-Generated Commit Messages with Code and Issue Context
researches.description: This project studies how effectively large language models (LLMs) generate commit messages by combining information from code differences and related issue descriptions. The research uses curated data from open-source repositories and incorporates expert feedback for qualitative evaluation. It involves guiding two undergraduate students through research design and execution, dataset preparation, prompt experimentation, metric definition, and validation through industry collaboration.

researches.title: BaDLAD: A Large Multi-Domain Bengali Document Layout Analysis Dataset
researches.info: Published in the International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition (ICDAR) pages 326-341, August 2023.
researches.description: BaDLAD is the first large Bengali Document Layout Analysis Dataset containing 33,695 annotated samples from six domains. This dataset can help develop deep learning-based models for OCR and document transcription in Bengali language. Preliminary experiments show the efficacy of BaDLAD in training these models.
involvements: Managed a team of 13 annotators to create BaDLAD, the most extensive multi-domain Bengali Document Layout Analysis Dataset, featuring 33,700 document images and over 710,000 polygon-based annotations.
Standardized annotation exports, conducted in-depth data analysis and visualizations, and optimized the dataset for machine learning compatibility and validation workflows.
Co-authored a publication introducing BaDLAD, which was used to train deep learning models for Bengali document digitization and layout understanding.
Developed a Bengali lemmatizer and assembled the largest known dataset of Bengali verb forms, systematically organized by grammatical categories and tense.
